message:
Guys I decided I won't just remove posts ... I will ban and block users too ... I am accountable for what I was assigned to and I won't let see some wannabes taking over this place.
Thanks

data.message:
I disagree with removing users!

They should be allowed to read what we share, it is part of the learning process. One day they will be beginners no more, and we will need their input here. 

I say give them a warning or two. If the violation continues, remove them. But at least give them a warning.
واحد مسمي نفسه (عبوده الإنسان) وبيقولك انا كنت فاكركوا جييكس في كل حاجة طلعتوا جييكس في الويب بس ... مش ناقصه محن ياعم مصعب أكيد انا مش حشيل واحد بيسأل سؤال حتى لو كان بسيط :)
I wasn't talking about banning Newbies ... I was talking about banning weirdos
طب كنت استنى لما نشوف عبوده الجيك هيقول ايه لعبوده الانسان :D

If you can blow his house up as well do it! :D

Seriously though, you should not ban him directly, unless there is a warning or a clear set of rules to follow that he violated!

Leaving it open for personal interpretations (even if all members agree on this specific interpretation) is pretty dangerous.

That's my opinion :)
By definition, we are all "weirdos" in a way or another :)

Mohamed Badawi http://i.imgur.com/Jx9lusJ.gif
Mosab Ahmad then we will have to define rules to ban members
:D

شفت؟ لسة تعليقي ما كملش دقيقتين، وأحد أصدقائنا "الويردو" كتب تعليق :D

منور يا عب غني :D
Ahmad Abd-Elghany
أيوة يا جدعان بس يعني هو الواحد عامل ban لنص صفحات Facebook اللي تشل عشان يخش الجروب يلاقي عبودة الإنسان؟ نقلبها أساحبي يعني؟
ما رسمتش histogram بالأسماء قبل ما أسمي الواد، فما أخدتش بالي إنه كتر أوي :D
أنا عندي أدم برضه :)

برضه .. أنت هنا مش على بروفايلك الشخصي .. أنت هنا في مجموعة يا ألفي .. ومن مصلحة المجموعة يكون في قواعد .. وprocess واضحة للتعامل مع أي خروج عليها .. غير كده هيبقى في فوضى كتير ..

بالمناسبة أنا ما عنديش أي مشكلة مع الأناركية .. بس ساعتها كل عضو في المجموعة يبقى أدمن .. أو ولا عضو يبقى أدمن :)
طيب انا متفق معاك نحط قواعد تنظم الـ Ban

Now you are talking :) 

Draft some rules and share it with the group and lets get some rules :)
يجماعة الموضوع بسيط - قواعد البان هي مخالفة قواعد الجروب اكتر من مرة رغم التحذير - بس

Disagree with removing users
+1 for Mosab Ahmad you may send the user a warning first

في واحد عامل الجروب درس خصوصي، كل شوية يكتب شوية كود و ييجي يقول لك انا عملت كذا و ناقص لي كذا، اجيبه منين؟ اهو ده مثال صارخ لحتمية البان :D

ممكن اقترح شوية قواعد للبوستات الغير مناسبة:
1- اللي بيطلب نعمل له شغله، مثال: اجيب منين سايد بار نافيجيشن شكله حلو؟

2- بوستات التيتوريالز الهايفة، من عينة اتعلم جافاسكريبت في تلات ايام و ربع

3- الاعلانات المباشرة لمنتج/موقع ربحي

عاوز أأكد على نقطة قلناها قبل كدة و هي ان الهدف مش التنطيط على خلق الله، و انما في اماكن تانية مخصصة للكلام ده، زي مثلا ستاك اوفرفلو، و الجروب لا يهدف و لا يقدر ينافسه من اساسه، يبقى ملوش لازمة تضييع الوقت و الجهد

This is an example of someone requesting to *join*
http://imgur.com/SXai9gw
Would you allow him in?

Such theatrical display is uncalled for. It's within your responsibilities to carry out removals and permanent bans for members that display a potential threat to the community's fabric. No need to open it for debate, each of the admin members is selected carefully to fit a specific criteria, in layman's terms a good admin is a good judge of character, fair and not trigger hungry.

People that get added and within a few minutes post an ad, I've banned and will continue to ban many of those as they come along. 
Warnings are mostly subliminal, should come in a corrective, constructive form. Most people get the gist and back-off from an unwanted behaviour.

Very rare cases should require an explicitly clear ban warning, like the case of this lame series of posts by a group of wanna-be developers building a clone of bufferapp. They generated a lot of friction enough to force a couple of admins and myself to explicitly give out warnings. The warnings went into effect as well, sad as it sounds but necessary.

The dude that keeps posting about wordpress, displaying little to no will for learning, self-improving and contributing something worth the community's time shouldn't get banned, he got the gist after a few harsh but constructive comments and a couple of post deletions.

Other cases that require clear corrective actions, banning being the last on the list are policy violations. Ads are prohibited, a clear spam behaviour as mentioned above demands a ban.

Other cases (most of them) of an ad being posted don't require a ban until the offender has repeated that action multiple times. Other cases require patience, like job posts. A new system was put in place, stated in the policy yet people still post here.
A few corrective comments and now any new job ad is removed immediately without warning or instructions.

Another case, that walked the gray line with me was automated posts. I've monitored someone post from an app, on a regular schedule 4 posts on two groups without regard to the nature of the post and its relevance to this group and it was a violation of policy. He didn't get a ban, a clear explicit warning was given and the problem was resolved.

 All in all, I see little reason behind this post and this discussion. You've been entrusted with a responsibility because you're fit to carry it through. Do what you need to do to keep the community healthy but exercise self control, patience and due diligence.

Good luck.

I've raised this point before and I'll raise it again, due diligence is required from the administrative team on who joins and who doesn't. Check the profiles, sift through their history, see what are they all about. Are they catfishing, are they selling something, do they look spammy.

Being selective on who joins and who doesn't will weed out the need to be selective on what's allowed to be posted and what isn't. Sadly as it appears to be, increasing numbers is a higher priority than increasing quality. By the time I get around checking the join requests, most if not all would have been approved without any proper background checks.

I check profiles and posts for people who would like to join ... I check posts of the new members and try to detect if there's something weird about it that might require extra attention for future posts.
Increasing number of the members should never be a goal ... Unless we want to turn this place into an annoying group that no body check.
I may was misunderstood guys ... When I was talking about banning, I was talking about something similar to the profile I posted 2 posts ago.

لا احنا منعملهمش بان .... احنا نضربهم ضربت رجل واحد ...yes this place only for developers be nesr we dabora 3ala el 2a2al or ykon 3ando 2 accounts 3ala el facebook 2yohoma 2krab ... sa7 el makan dah mish lel "بوستات التيتوريالز الهايفة" 3shan ttklm hina lazm yb2a "مقال موووووودهش" ... if you want place only for "beautiful minds " you can go to the country club ... here should be reference for people who don't know how to ... also to pull them up , not to evaluate their questions

The statement "evaluate their questions" has a strong negative connotation without a proper context, so let me put a context.
The group was intended and will continue to be a hub for experienced _professionals_ in most technology disciplines. These members are there to share their practical real-world experiences, things you wouldn't otherwise get from a blog post, a question on stack overflow or a tutorial.

Things you need to interact with someone on a personal level to learn about.

Back to your comment, about the only right thing you said, is that the group is for people "who don't know how to". The filtering efforts that have and will continue to take place, are to qualify the types of "how tos". In other words, if you're looking for how to track your wordpress analytics with a plugin and asking if anyone knows a plugin then you're at the wrong place.

I'd rather see someone asking about a technical detail in writing a wordpress plugin, with another answering, sharing their experience from writing their own wordpress plugins.

If it exists on Google, it doesn't belong here. It's a blanket statement, but in a gist it's quite true. If I can find it on Google, you can. Some people ask rather silly questions, but they display a clear indication that they did their research and couldn't find a solution. Others treat the group like "مدونة أبو رامي"

On a side note, what's the correlation between "beautiful minds" and a "country club"?
